radiographic_examinations.findings: Several shadowing stones are identified in the gallbladder, the largest of which measures 1.8 cm and appears to be lodged in the neck of the gallbladder. No evidence of focal lesions or ductal abnormality. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilation. There is no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. The gallbladder does not appear to be distended. The common bile duct measures 7 mm.
